Comment: Hewitt (1979) glosses yə- as ‘it’ in such cases. In the context of human nouns, də- ‘(s)he’ is used instead, as in the examples below. For a description/discussion of column I-III affixes, see pp. 101-103.
By contrast, such occurrences of yə- are glossed as ‘who’ in Hewitt (1979; e.g., p. 36). The examples below show that it remains invariant with human nouns.
The yə- marker disappears/becomes null when its referent immediately precedes the verb (p. 101).
The relative affix yə- can’t be omitted on the relativized verb.
The order adjective/stat.verb ≻ complement is available only if the latter is a PP (p. 109), cf. examples above.
